xxl.core.predicates
Class InputStreamEqualPredicate

java.lang.Object
  xxl.core.predicates.AbstractPredicate<java.io.InputStream>
      xxl.core.predicates.InputStreamEqualPredicate
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable, Predicate<java.io.InputStream>
public class InputStreamEqualPredicate
extends AbstractPredicate<java.io.InputStream>

This class provides a binary predicate that returns true if the input stream given as the first argument is equal to the second.

See Also:

Field Detail

DEFAULT_INSTANCE

public static final InputStreamEqualPredicate DEFAULT_INSTANCE
This instance can be used for getting a default instance of InputStreamEqualPredicate. It is similar to the Singleton Design Pattern (for further details see Creational Patterns, Prototype in Design Patterns: Elements of Reusable Object-Oriented Software by Erich Gamma, Richard Helm, Ralph Johnson, and John Vlissides) except that there are no mechanisms to avoid the creation of other instances of InputStreamEqualPredicate.
